title: How a messy accident at a coffee house altered this artist's career
description: In a coffee shop in Lagos, Nigeria, visual artist Ekene Ngige was meeting with some colleagues when he had an accidental eureka moment that would change the course of his career.

title: New details of what was found with remains of Brian Laundrie
description: The FBI's Denver office said that remains found in a Florida nature reserve are those of Brian Laundrie, the man who went missing last month. The FBI said dental records confirmed the identification. CNN's Randi Kaye reports.

title: Facebook kept its own oversight board in the dark on program for VIP users
description: Facebook failed to provide crucial details about its "Cross-Check" program that reportedly shielded millions of VIP users from the social media platform's normal content moderation rules, according to the company's oversight board.

title: Alleged murderer of UK lawmaker had terrorist links, court hears
description: A man has been charged with the murder of MP David Amess, who was stabbed to death in his constituency east of London last week, prosecutors in the United Kingdom said on Thursday.

title: The Russian capital will impose restrictions for 10 days, in a bid to curb soaring Covid-19 cases as the country faces its worst-ever phase of the pandemic
description: Moscow will impose a 10-day lockdown from next week in an effort to curb soaring Covid-19 cases, the city's mayor has said, as Russia endures its worst-ever phase of the pandemic.

title: Meghan urges Schumer and Pelosi to pass federal paid family leave
description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, is urging Congressional Democratic leadership to pass federal paid family and medical leave and "ensure this consequential moment is not lost" as Democrats continue to negotiate a deal to pass the Biden administration's social safety net and infrastructure package.

title: Huge crowds march in Sudan in support of civilian rule
description: Throngs of Sudanese protesters took to the streets on Thursday to voice their support for civilian rule within the country's power-sharing government.

title: Ruby Rose alleges unsafe working conditions on 'Batwoman' set
description: Ruby Rose says unsafe working conditions and a toxic culture on the CW series "Batwoman" led to their departure from the show in 2020.

title: Powerful gas explosion rips through building in China
description: At least four people were killed and more than 30 injured in the blast that happened in the northeastern city of Shenyang, according to local authorities.

title: UK government accused of being 'willfully negligent' as Covid cases mount
description: Britain's doctors' union has accused Boris Johnson's government of being "willfully negligent" in its handling of the latest wave of the Covid-19 pandemic, as ministers refuse to introduce mitigation measures despite soaring infection rates and increasing pressure on hospitals.

title: Trump planning a return to Wall Street
description: Former President Donald Trump is planning a return to Wall Street.

title: Why Donald Trump's new social media company is doomed to fail
description: Donald Trump is -- finally -- getting into the social media game.

title: Strong probability that the suspected remains are Brian Laundrie's, attorney says
description: The apparent human remains that authorities found Wednesday in a Florida park most likely belong to Brian Laundrie, the missing man whose fiancée Gabby Petito was found fatally strangled last month, the Laundrie family attorney told CNN.

title: Hear former CNN bureau chief's plea to Facebook after winning Nobel Prize
description: Former CNN journalist and Rappler CEO Maria Ressa speaks with Becky Anderson after Ressa and Russian journalist Dmitry Muratov won the Nobel Peace Prize for their longstanding efforts to safeguard freedom of expression in the Philippines and Russia, respectively.

title: Moscow is going back into lockdown as Covid-19 deaths multiply in Russia
Tesla's 'full self-driving' rolls back its privacy protection of trip videos
description: Tesla owners can buy the company's "full self-driving" software for $10,000, but they may have to pay with their privacy.

title: Cara Delevingne's father suggests she was named after in-flight magazine
description: Origin stories are a powerful part of celebrity culture that can help fans identify with the stars.

title: This priest was kidnapped in Haiti. He tells CNN what it was like
description: The recent kidnapping of 17 missionaries by a gang in Haiti has highlighted a brutal yet common occurrence in the country. CNN's Matt Rivers reports from Haiti's capital, Port-au-Prince.

title: Boston Celtics game broadcast pulled in China after Enes Kanter's pro-Tibet posts
description: The NBA is facing another incident involving China after Enes Kanter, center for the Boston Celtics, criticized the country's treatment of Tibet.

title: Cardi B and Penn Badgley are the Twitter friendship we didn't know we needed
description: What's the relationship status when you swap Twitter avis?

title: Steve Bannon and voting rights cases call into question two basic principles of the US system
description: George Washington's nightmare is coming true.

title: An American couple was ready to return home after a trip when a positive Covid test stopped them
description: There's no denying that going on vacation has become a lot more complicated due to Covid-19.

title: Parents of 6-year-old girl killed on amusement park ride file wrongful death suit
description: The parents of a 6-year-old who died on a free-fall ride at a Colorado amusement park in September have filed a wrongful death lawsuit against the park, according to their attorney.

title: WeWork is finally going public. A lot has changed
description: When WeWork's plans for a blockbuster initial public offering imploded in 2019, the company became a poster child for the excesses of venture capital and startup culture in the post-2008 era.

title: Biden sees US credibility on the line as he races to lock down climate action ahead of COP26
description: President Joe Biden wanted the stakes to be perfectly clear when he sat down with nine liberal Democrats in the Oval Office Tuesday to discuss ongoing legislative negotiations.

title: 5 expert tips to stress less this fall
description: As we head into what was supposed to be the fall recovery, the world is still reeling from Covid-related anxiety. It shows up in tepid job recovery and stock market tremors as well as in disagreements over masks and vaccine requirements in our schools and communities.

title: Jim Jordan struggles to answer question on Jan. 6. Keilar rolls the tape
description: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) has repeatedly struggled to answer whether or not he spoke with former President Donald Trump on the day rioters stormed the US Capitol. CNN's Brianna Keilar rolls the tape.

title: Evergrande says a $2.6 billion sale has collapsed as it inches closer to default
description: Evergrande has called off plans for a multibillion-dollar deal for its property management unit, worsening its cash crunch as the Chinese real estate giant teeters on the brink of collapse and faces the risk of its first official default.

title: Netflix made a mess of the Dave Chappelle controversy. It's a crisis of Netflix's own making
description: The Dave Chappelle comedy special, "The Closer," has thrust Netflix into its biggest crisis ever. It's a mess of the company's own making.

title: Australian police offer A$1 million reward for missing 4-year-old
description: The Western Australian government has offered a 1 million Australian dollar ($750,000) reward for information that leads to the whereabouts of a 4-year-old girl missing for six days in a remote coastal area.

title: CNN talks with Nigerian Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka
description: CNN's Larry Madowo speaks with African Nobel laureate Wole Soyinka. He has released his first book in almost half a century, which explores themes of rebellion and abuse of power in a country similar to his native Nigeria.

title: South Korea fails to put dummy satellite into orbit
description: South Korea failed to put a dummy satellite into orbit on Thursday after the first launch of its domestically developed three-stage Nuri rocket, the country's President Moon Jae-in announced on Thursday.

title: Xander Schauffele reveals his father is 'hogging' his Olympic gold medal
description: He's enjoyed the summer of a lifetime, and Xander Schauffele is determined to keep the good times rolling.

title: Spanx, the shapewear brand, valued at $1.2 billion in Blackstone deal
description: Spanx, one of America's most prominent shapewear companies, is now worth $1.2 billion after inking a deal with Blackstone.

title: The company behind Dove and Ben & Jerry's is hiking prices
description: Unilever is hiking prices to cope with soaring supply chain costs and expects inflation to accelerate into next year.

title: Meet the luxury travel agent who plans trips for former US presidents and world leaders
description: On a personal trip to Ethiopia in 2015, former US President George W. Bush encountered a pleasant surprise.

title: Julie Green, artist who painted prisoners' last meals, dies aged 60
description: The painter Julie Green died last Tuesday, October 12, aged 60, after a battle with ovarian cancer, the artist's gallery, Upfor, confirmed.

title: World's top cocaine producer now wants to export perfectly legal drug
description: Colombia wants to become a major player in the international market for medical marijuana as the industry is creating an economic opportunity some have never seen before. CNN's Stefano Pozzebon reports.

title: Floods and landslides kill at least 150 in India and Nepal
description: Record-breaking rains and heavy flooding have killed at least 150 people in India and Nepal over the past few days, according to disaster management officials.

title: North Korea accuses US and UN of 'tampering with a dangerous time bomb'
description: North Korea said the United States and the UN Security Council are "tampering with a dangerous time bomb" following a meeting over the isolated nation's most recent ballistic missile test, state media reported.

title: Level 5 atmospheric river to unleash flooding across drought-stricken California
description: After nearly a year without rain, a series of potent Pacific storms are directed at Northern California this week, potentially bringing as much as a foot of rainfall and up to three feet of snow in the Sierra Nevada.

title: Fired officer curses governor in final sign off to colleagues
description: Two Washington State Patrol officers shared their goodbye messages after years of service because they wouldn't comply with a vaccination mandate. Over 100 of their colleagues are also leaving.

title: MMA fighter Conor McGregor accused of unprovoked attack by Italian DJ
description: An Italian DJ claims he suffered a number of injuries following an alleged altercation with MMA fighter Conor McGregor.
